Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617. If you do not submit the
CWL-4617, it will be treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee what have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisor, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of the residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/10/25, a youth snuck into another youth's room and forced
the youth to have sex. A safety plan was implemented to place the
youth on separate units.
Investigation Interviews:
Program Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
August 12, 2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A said at
bedtime on August 10, 2025, she was let into her room by a staff,
she could not remember who opened the door, other than it was a
short black female, as she walked in and walked away. Youth A
said since the staff had walked away, she was able to prop open
her door so that it did not latch. Youth A said she intentionally did
not latch her door so that she could come out without sounding
her alarm. Youth A said she came out of her room a few minutes
later and saw Staff 1 distracted by paperwork and her cell phone
so she was able to sneak across the hall. She stood there a few
moments to make sure Staff 1 was not watching and Youth B
opened his door, and she went into his room. Youth A said Youth
B asked her “are you in here to you know?”, to which she
responded, “not really, but do you wanna?”, and Youth B said
“sure”. Youth A said she and Youth B then proceed to have sex in
his bedroom. Youth A said she was in Youth B’s room for about
30 to 60 minutes before Staff 1 came to do a bedroom check.
Youth A said she heard Staff 1 opening doors to other bedrooms,
so she knew that she was doing bedroom checks. She hid around
the corner of Youth B’s doorway, so Staff 1 did not see her when
she completed the check. Youth A said Youth B then went out of
2

the room to distract Staff 1 so she could sneak out. Youth A said
Staff 1 did not see her exit Youth B’s room. Youth A said she was
very concerned about getting pregnant, so she decided to tell Staff
1 what had just occurred. Youth A said after speaking to Staff 1
she went to bed. Youth A said she was taken to the hospital the
following day for medical attention. Youth A said this has never
happened previously and staff were not aware of the incident until
she told them.
Youth B was interviewed at Genesee Voices for Children on
September 3, 2025. I watched the interview via Zoom and
participated by submitting questions while Youth B was being
interviewed. Youth B was very hesitant to talk and did not want to
answer many questions as he kept repeating “I don’t want to talk
about it”. However eventually reported Youth A pushed him out of
the way and entered his room. Youth B said he thought Youth A
wanted to talk with him but then threatened to hurt him if he did
not have sex with her. Youth B said he had sex with Youth A and
then she left and went back into her room. Youth B said he does
not know which staff were working or where they were during the
incident. Youth B said staff are supposed to check on them when
they are in their bedrooms, but staff were not checking that night.
Youth B said sex was not planned and no staff knew it was
happening. Youth B said he eventually told a staff member, he
was unsure who, what had happened that night. Youth B said he
feels safe now that Youth A has been moved to a different unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said the
evening of August 10, 2025, was very chaotic with several youth
being outside misbehaving and not following programming. Staff 1
said the youth in the unit were all off schedule for bedtime and did
not go to bed until between 8:45pm and 9pm. Staff 1 said she
placed all youths in their bedrooms and made sure the doors were
shut. Staff 1 said Staff 2 had been punched in the eye during the
incident outside and was “going off”, so she asked her if she
needed a 10-minute break since the youth were in bed. She said
yes and left for thirty to forty minutes. Staff 1 said she was alone in
the unit and began to start incident report paperwork for the issues
that had occurred outside. Staff 1 said Youth A’s door alarm went
off and she peeked her head out of her door and was told to go
back into her room. Staff 1 said Youth A did this three times and
each time was told to go back into her room. Staff 1 said she
never saw Youth A leave her doorway and each time she peeked
out she was holding her door open so she did not have to go
down the hallway to unlock Youth A’s door to let her back into her
3

room. She did not go down the hallway to make sure Youth A’s
door was shut the last time she told her to go into her room. Staff
1 said she never saw Youth A exit her doorway and believed she
was in her bedroom after the third time peeking out her door.
Staff 1 said she did not get a chance to start bed checks because
she was the only staff on the unit and had to work on paperwork.
Staff 1 said she completed a room check on Youth A. She was not
in her room, so she took her DVD player out of her room as youth
are not allowed certain items if they are not following the rules.
Staff 1 said the unit cell phone was broken so she did not have a
way to call anyone to come help her look for Youth A. Staff 1 said
she had her cell phone, but it was dead, so she decided to use
Youth A’s DVD player to charge her phone so she could make a
call to Staff 2 or Supervisor. Staff 1 said another youth came out
of her room and asked to use the bathroom and at the same time
Youth A came out of Youth B’s room and asked to use the
bathroom. Staff 1 said Youth A said she needed to talk to her and
proceeded to tell her that she thought she was pregnant because
she and Youth B just had sex. Staff 1 said she asked her if she
was serious and she said yes and then she told her she needed to
report it and told Staff 2. Staff 1 said Youth A told her that when
she had come out of her room she never went back into the room
and had gone across the hallway into Youth B’s room. Staff 1 said
Youth B does not have an alarm on his bedroom door due to it
being a trigger for him and most nights he sleeps with his door
propped open because he is scared of the dark. Staff 1 denied
talking to Youth B about the incident and he was moved to
another unit for the night. Staff 1 said she could “only do so much
alone” and did not see Youth A go into Youth B’s room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said
August 10, 2025, was a “rough shift” with many youths refusing to
follow directions and being outside after the allowed time. Staff 2
said she was hit in the eye by a youth during the incidents outside.
Staff 2 said she helped Staff 1 get all the youth into their rooms for
bedtime around 9pm. She spoke to Staff 1 and decided to take a
break in the manager’s office to write incident reports from the
evening incidents. Staff 2 said she was out of the unit for about
thirty to forty minutes and came back to the unit briefly and then
left again. Staff 2 said she was only gone for a few minutes the
second time and when she returned Youth A, Youth B, and one
other youth were all out of their rooms, which is unusual as staff
will typically only allow one youth out at a time after bedtime. Staff
2 said Staff 1 walked over to her and stated, “now I have to write
4

that up”. Staff 2 asked what happened and Staff 1 told her Youth
A reported she thought she might be pregnant due to having sex
with Youth B. Staff 2 said she asked Staff 1 when it happened and
she said, “just now”. Staff 2 said she told Staff 1 she would go get
Supervisor and left the unit.
Staff 2 said she returned to the unit and asked Staff 1 if she had
been doing bed checks to which she responded she had not
started them yet. Staff 2 said bed checks are supposed to start
when the first youth goes to bed, which is normally 8pm and are to
be done at varying intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes. Staff 2
said Staff 1 told her she saw Youth A exit Youth B’s room and
when talking to Youth B he reported that Youth A “forced” him to
have sex with her and said she would “hurt him” if he did not
comply. Staff 2 said the normal process for bedtime is the youth
line up by the benches around 8pm. Staff working will walk down
the hallway with all of them letting them in their rooms one at a
time and ensuring the bedroom doors shut behind them. Staff 2
said each youth, except Youth B, has an alarm on their door so if
they open it after being let in the alarm will sound. Staff 2 said if a
youth needs to come out of their room after bedtime they are
supposed to knock on their door, staff will ask who it is and what
they need and then assist them and ensure they are back in their
room with the door shut once they have their need met. Staff 2
said she has worked with Staff 1 previously and has never had
concerns about her lack of supervision or checks on the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
August 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor said she was working the night of August 10, 2025,
when she received a call from Staff 2 in a panic. Supervisor said
Staff 2 told her she returned to the unit and Staff 1 told her that
Youth A reported having sex with Youth B. Supervisor said she
asked Staff 2 when this occurred, and Staff 2 said “just now”.
Supervisor said she made a plan to have Youth B moved to
another unit for the night until a more permanent plan could be
made the following day with administration involvement.
Supervisor denied speaking to Youth B directly, however she said
when speaking to Youth A she appeared very remorseful and said
the day had been very stressful for her. Supervisor said Youth A
told her Staff 1 did not know she was in Youth B’s room.
Supervisor said the normal procedure for bedtime starts at 8pm
when the youth line up at the benches. Staff working will walk
them all down and let them in the rooms one by one, ensuring
each youth enters their rooms and the doors shut behind them.
5

Supervisor said the bedroom doors lock automatically behind the
youth so no one can go in without a key or the youth opening the
door from the inside. Supervisor said each youth has an alarm on
their door so if they are opened it would sound, except for Youth
B, as the alarm is a trigger for him therefore, he does not have
one. Supervisor said youth are supposed to knock on their door
before coming out of their room at bedtime. Supervisor said staff
then answer them and allow them out and assist them with
whatever they need and then make sure they go back into their
rooms with the doors closed. Supervisor said if the bedtime
routine was done correctly, Staff 1 would have heard the alarm on
Youth A’s door go off when she exited her room and she should
have known Youth A’s whereabouts from the time she left her
room until she went back into her room.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 10, 2025, hallway of McDonald unit
outside Youth A and Youth B’s bedrooms was reviewed on
August 11, 2025. At 8:55pm, Staff 2 is standing in the hallway
next to Youth A’s room. Youth A begins to walk down the hallway
and Staff 2 opens Youth A’s bedroom door and holds the door
open as Youth A walks into her room. Staff 2 is facing away from
Youth A’s room and let’s go of the door and walks away as Youth
A goes into the room. Staff 2 does not look at the door to see if it
is shut properly. At 8:56pm, Youth A is seen coming out of her
room and peeking around the corner down the hallway to where
Staff 1 is standing and plugging a cell phone into another device,
picking up papers and moves to the desk at the end of the
hallway. Youth A moves across the hallway from her room and is
standing with her back to the wall in the hallway for about one
minute as she slowly moves down the hallway a few steps and
around the corner into Youth B’s room. Youth A entered Youth B’s
room at 8:58pm. Staff 1 is seen doing various tasks including
paperwork and entering/exiting the laundry/storage room area. At
9:28pm Staff 1 is seen walking down to the end of the hallway and
going to each room on her way back. She looks in Youth B’s room
at 9:30pm, then in Youth A’s room right afterwards. Staff 1 is in
Youth A’s room for about one minute and is seen exiting with a
computer in her hands. Youth B peeks his head out of his
doorway about thirty seconds later and then stands in his doorway
talking with Staff 1. Youth B exits his room and walks to the staff
desk at 9:32pm. Youth A exits Youth B’s room at 9:33pm, Staff 1
is standing in the hallway and sees her exiting the room. Staff 1
then opens one bathroom for Youth A, and the second bathroom
for Youth B.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s after visit summary from Hurley Medical Center,
dated August 11, 2025, was reviewed. The summary
indicates reason for visit was “screening for sexually
transmitted diseases”
• Youth B’s after visit summary from Hurley Medical Center,
dated August 11, 2025, was reviewed. The summary
indicates reason for visit was “trauma: sexual assault”
• Incident Report written by Staff 1, dated August 10, 2025,
which was consistent with her interview.
• Incident Report written by Staff 2, dated August 11, 2025,
which was consistent with her interview.
• Incident Report written by Supervisor, dated August 10,
2025, which was consistent with her interview.
• Whaley Children’s Center Program Statement was
reviewed. The program statement indicates a staffing ratio
of 1:3 during daytime hours, and 1:6 during nighttime
hours.
• Whaley Children’s Center Technology Use Policies was
reviewed. The policy specifically states “Use of personal
cell phones is not permitted for direct care staff while
working a shift. Personal cell phone use is not permitted
except for emergency situations in which the Unit/Group
home Cell phone cannot be utilized. Staff also have
access to the landline phones and two-way radios
designated for their respective location.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was disciplinary action on
February 10, 2025, for failure to comply with job standards
due to missing a policy review deadline. Staff 1 participated
in training for “Residential Policy Review; Supervision
Standards, Interactions, Expectations” on May 1, 2025.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was disciplinary action on
July 19, 2025, for failure to comply with job standards due
to missing a policy review deadline. Staff 2 completed Third
Shift Bed Check Policy on August 7, 2025.
• Youth A’s Whaley Children’s Center Admission Notification
dated July 15, 2025, was reviewed. The notification outlines
Youth A’s history which includes “an incident on 4/15/25 in
which she was found in another peer's bedroom”, and
“engagement in sexualized behaviors with a peer,
prompting discussions about her poor boundaries and the
necessity for a sexual safety plan upon admission.”
• Whaley Children’s Center Youth A’s safety plan dated
7/14/25 was reviewed. The safety plan specifically states
“[Youth A] must not go into the doorways or rooms of her
peers. Staff should monitor [Youth A] closely when she is in
7

the hallway or common areas due to her history of
sneaking out of her room or allowing others to enter rooms
when staff are not paying attention.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance per youth and staff
interviews, documentation review, and video review. Youth A’s
admission notification outlined her history and prior behaviors
resulting in her safety plan that ensured higher levels of
supervision for her specifically in hallways and common areas.
Staff 1 did not provide adequate supervision, Youth A reported
Staff 1 was distracted by paperwork and her cell phone, and Staff
1 reported she was alone due to Staff 2 being on a break for 30-
40 minutes and was concerned about getting her cell phone
charged and completing paperwork. Due to the lack of supervision
and not following Youth A’s safety plan, she was able to enter
Youth B’s bedroom.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the agency specifically identify the hours that
are considered “daytime” and “nighttime” for ratio purposes.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation On 8/10/25, a youth went into another youth's room and eye-on
checks were not done as required.

doorway, so Staff 1 did not see her when she completed the

check. Youth A said this has never happened previously and that
staff were not aware of the incident until she told them.
Youth B was interviewed at Genesee Voices for Children on
September 3, 2025. I watched the interview via Zoom and
participated by submitting questions while Youth B was being
interviewed. Youth B said he does not know which staff were
working or where they were during the incident. Youth B said staff
are supposed to check on them when they are in their bedrooms,
but staff were not checking that night.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said she
did not get a chance to start bed checks because she was the
only staff on the unit and had to work on paperwork. Staff 1 said
she completed a room check on Youth A and she was not in her
room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said she
asked Staff 1 if she had been doing bed checks to which she
responded she had not started them yet. Staff 2 said bed checks

normally 8pm and are to be done at varying intervals not to
exceed fifteen minutes. Staff 2 said she has worked with Staff 1
previously and has never had concerns about her lack of
supervision or checks on the youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 10, 2025, hallway of McDonald unit
outside Youth A and Youth B’s bedrooms was reviewed on
August 11, 2025. At 8:55pm, Staff 2 is standing in the hallway
next to Youth A’s room. Youth A begins to walk down the hallway
and Staff 2 opens Youth A’s bedroom door and holds the door

Staff 1 is standing and plugging a cell phone into another device,
picking up papers and moves to the desk at the end of the
hallway. Youth A moves across the hallway from her room and is
standing with her back to the wall in the hallway for about one
minute as she slowly moves down the hallway a few steps and
around the corner into Youth B’s room. Youth A entered Youth B’s
room at 8:58pm. Staff 1 is seen doing various tasks including
9

paperwork and entering/exiting the laundry/storage room area. At
9:28pm Staff 1 is seen walking down to the end of the hallway and
going to each room on her way back. She looks in Youth B’s room
at 9:30pm, then in Youth A’s room right afterwards. Staff 1 is in
Youth A’s room for about one minute and is seen exiting with a
computer in her hands. Youth B peeks his head out of his
doorway about thirty seconds later and then stands in his doorway
talking with Staff 1. Youth B exits his room and walks to the staff
desk at 9:32pm. Youth A exits Youth B’s room at 9:33pm. Staff 1
is standing in the hallway and sees her exiting the room. Staff 1
then opens one bathroom for Youth A, and the second bathroom

Documents Reviewed:
• Whaley Children’s Center Program Statement was
reviewed. The program statement indicates a staffing ratio
of 1:3 during daytime hours, and 1:6 during nighttime
hours.
• Bed check logs dated August 10, 2025, for McDonald unit
were reviewed. The bed checks did not begin until
10:15pm, and none were completed by either Staff 1 or
Staff 2.
• Whaley Children’s Center Third Shift Policy/Bed Checks
was reviewed. The policy outlines the expectation that staff
must perform bed checks at random intervals of less than
15 minutes whenever youth are in their bedrooms and
document all checks completed on the bed check log.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was disciplinary action on
February 10, 2025, for failure to comply with job standards
due to missing a policy review deadline. Staff 1 participated
in training for “Residential Policy Review; Supervision
Standards, Interactions, Expectations” on May 1, 2025.
• Youth A’s safety plan was reviewed. The safety plan
specifically states “[Youth A] must not go into the doorways
or rooms of her peers. Staff should monitor [Youth A]
closely when she is in the hallway or common areas due to
her history or sneaking out of her room or allowing others to
enter rooms when staff are not paying attention.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, and video review, Staff 1 did not complete variable
interval, eye-on checks of youth, resulting in Youth A being in
Youth B’s room for 35 minutes.
Conclusion Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 2 did not complete the bedtime procedure according to the
agency policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A said at
bedtime on August 10, 2025, she was let into her room by a staff,
she could not remember who other than a short black female, who
opened the door as she walked in and walked away. Youth A said
since the staff had walked away, she was able to prop open her
door so that it did not latch. Youth A said she intentionally did not
latch her door so that she could come out without sounding her
alarm.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 said she
placed all youths in their bedrooms and made sure the doors were
shut.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on August
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 said she
helped Staff 1 get all the youth into their rooms for bedtime around
9pm. Staff 2 said the normal process for bedtime is the youth line
up by the benches around 8pm. Staff working will walk down the
hallway with all of them letting them in their rooms one at a time
and ensuring the bedroom doors shut behind them.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
August 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor said the normal procedure for bedtime starts at 8pm
when the youth line up at the benches. Staff working will walk
them all down and let them in the rooms one by one, ensuring
each youth enters their rooms and the doors shut behind them.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 10, 2025, hallway of McDonald unit
outside Youth A and Youth B’s bedrooms was reviewed on
11

August 11, 2025. At 8:55pm, Staff 2 is standing in the hallway
next to Youth A’s room. Youth A begins to walk down the hallway
and Staff 2 opens Youth A’s bedroom door and holds the door
open as Youth A walks into her room. Staff 2 is facing away from
Youth A’s room and let’s go of the door and walks away as Youth
A goes into the room. Staff 2 does not look at the door to see if it
is shut properly.
Documents Reviewed:
• Whaley Children’s Center Bedtime Procedures was
reviewed. The bedtime procedure specifically states “After
preparing the children for bedtime, staff must walk them to
their rooms and unlock the door to grant them access into
their bedroom. Staff must ensure that the door is closed
and locked before leaving the doorway area.”
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was disciplinary action on
July 19, 2025, for failure to comply with job standards due
to missing a policy review deadline. Staff 2 completed Third
Shift Bed Check Policy on August 7, 2025.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance with Program Statement.
Youth A’s interview and video review, Staff 2 opened Youth A’s
door at bedtime. Staff 2 did not follow the agency procedure as
she did not look to ensure Youth A’s door was closed and locked
before walking away.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
